materials.raw_text:
Lithium carbonate (Li2CO3) - 27.5 g 
 Nickel oxide (NiO) - 62.5 g 
 Phosphate source (e.g., ammonium phosphate) - 20 g 
 Vanadium pentoxide (V2O5) - 5 g 
 Binder (e.g., polyvinyl alcohol) - 10 g 
 Deionized water - 50 g

sourcing.instructions:
Lithium carbonate can be sourced from chemical supply companies or online specialty chemical retailers. 
 Nickel oxide is available from chemical suppliers. 
 Ammonium phosphate can be found in agricultural supply stores or chemical retailers. 
 Vanadium pentoxide is available from chemical suppliers. 
 Polyvinyl alcohol can be sourced from craft stores or chemical suppliers. 
 Deionized water can be obtained from laboratory supply stores or made using a deionization system.

preparation.raw_text:
1. Measure out 27.5 g of lithium carbonate and 62.5 g of nickel oxide using a precision scale. 
 2. Add 20 g of ammonium phosphate and 5 g of vanadium pentoxide to the mixture. 
 3. In a separate container, dissolve 10 g of polyvinyl alcohol in 50 g of deionized water, stirring until fully dissolved. 
 4. Combine the dry ingredients into a mixing bowl, then gradually add the polyvinyl alcohol solution while stirring continuously to form a homogeneous paste.
